solution.text:
Perimeter of cylinder = Breadth of paper
\(= 2\pi r = _{{k*22}}_\)
Therefore, r = _{{k*Decimal('0.5')*7}}_ cm
Volume of a cylinder \(= \pi r^2h = _{{22*((k*Decimal('0.5'))**2)*j*7}}_ cm^3\)

content.text: Rajiv likes to make 3D shapes from paper. Yesterday, he started with a rectangular piece of paper of length _{j}_ cm and breadth _{{k*22}}_ cm. He then rolled the paper into a cylinder so that the cylinder is now _{j}_ cm long. What is the volume of the air inside the cylinder so formed?
